school.title: Current or most recent high school
school.toolTip: We ask this so we can match your transcripts to your application.

sais.label: SAIS
sais.toolTip: Student Accountability Information System (SAIS). Every student attending school in Arizona is assigned an official SAIS Student ID number by the state department. If you have attended school in Arizona within the last two years, you should already have an SAIS ID number. You can get this number from your previous school or use the 'lookup' feature on the Common Logon site.

highSchool.label: High School
highSchool.toolTip: Required for matching up student records.

options.text: My High School is not on the list
options.value: My High School is not on the list

school.transcriptNameLabel: Name printed on the transcript offered by this institution?

college.title: Colleges and universities
college.toolTip: Applicants must submit transcripts from each college listed here to ensure a full academic record. Failure to do so may negatively impact your admission or financial aid.
college.text: Arizona State University reserves the right to verify your prior enrollment. Failure to list a prior college or university on your application may result in denial of admission for failure to submit accurate information.

attendedCollege.label: Have you previously attended or are you currently attending a college or university?

college.semesterCreditsLabel: Enter the total number of college and/or university semester credits you have completed

items.title: Accepted credits
items.text: ASU accepts college-level (not remedial) courses in which transfer students have earned a grade of “C” (4.00=“A”) or better from regionally accredited colleges and universities.

items.title: Applicability
items.text: The applicability of a specific transfer course toward an ASU degree program depends on the requirements of the department, division, college or school in which you are enrolled at ASU.

items.title: Credit hours
items.text: A maximum of 64 semester hours of credit will be accepted as lower-division credit when transferred from a regionally accredited community, junior or two-year college, with the exception of some special programs. An unlimited number of credits hours will be accepted from four-year institutions. Upon admission to the university, you will work with an ASU academic advisor to determine how your transferable credits apply toward your selected major.

items.title: Credit conversion
items.text: Acceptable academic credits earned at other institutions that are based on a different unit of credit than the one prescribed by the Arizona Board of Regents are subject to conversion before being transferred to ASU. All ASU students must meet graduation requirements (university, college, major and general studies requirements) to earn a four-year degree.

items.title: Degree requirements
items.text: The ASU college of your major determines how transfer courses fulfill the degree requirements of your ASU major. You should review the degree requirements of the program into which you intend to transfer and talk with an academic advisor about your transfer credits and how they will apply to your degree program.

items.title: Determining GPA
items.text: Grades and honor points that you earned at other colleges and universities are considered for admission, but your ASU cumulative grade point average is based solely on coursework taken at ASU.

institution.title: Please enter each individual institution you have attended

options.text: Arizona General Education Curriculum in Progress
California State Univ Gen Ed (CSUGE) in Progress
Inter Gen Ed Trans Curriculum (IGETC) in Progress

institution.transcriptNameLabel: Name printed on the transcript offered by this institution?

eligibilityToReturn.label: Previous college eligibility
eligibilityToReturn.text: Are you eligible to return to each of the colleges or universities you have attended in the last seven years? If you have not attended college, please answer yes.

first.collegeLabel: List the most recent college/university for which you are ineligible to return first

reasons.title: Indicate below the reason why you are ineligible to return
reasons.explainationLabel: Please explain why you are ineligible to return to the college/university listed

second.collegeLabel: Additional college/university for which you are ineligible to return, if applicable:

reasons.title: Indicate below the reason why you are ineligible to return
reasons.explainationLabel: Please explain why you are ineligible to return to the college/university listed

transcriptPolicy.title: Transcript policy
transcriptPolicy.text: All applicants must send official transcripts from their school as an admissions requirement. This task will appear in My ASU after submitting your application.
transcriptPolicy.subText: Which transcripts do I need to send?
transcriptPolicy.acknowledgement: I acknowledge that I will need to submit official transcripts from the previous institutions I have attended.

transcriptRequirements.title: Transcript Requirements

items.title: High school transcripts only
items.text: If you have only high school transcripts and have not completed any college courses, then only submit high school transcripts. This includes GED transcripts.

items.title: High school and college transcripts
items.text: Submit both high school transcripts and college transcripts if you have completed less than 24 college credit hours or you are under the age of 22 years old.

items.title: College transcripts only
items.text: If you have 24 or more credit hours and are over the age of 22 years old, then submit college transcripts.* For example, if you have an associate degree, you do not need to submit high school transcripts.

transcriptRequirements.additionalTip: *Some programs may require high school transcripts regardless of transfer credits or age. Please be sure to refer to admission requirements for your program of choice.
